title: Machine Sans Nom (Machine with No Name)
medium: gouache and metallic paint on cardboard
provenance_text:
Francis Picabia [1879-1953]. (Modern Gallery, New York, NY, in January 1916) [1]. (Rose Fried Gallery, New York, NY, by 1950 until at least 1953) [2]. G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, until December 1955; Museum, December 1955 [3].
NOTES: [1] This work was exhibited at Modern Gallery, 500 5th Ave., New York, NY from January 5 until 25, 1916. [2] This work was exhibited at Rose Fried gallery in an exhibit titled "Picabia", in March of 1950. This work was no. 3 in that exhibit. The work was exhibited at the Walker Art Center from April until June 1953 and was lent to the exhibition by Rose Fried Gallery according to the "Classic Tradition in Contemporary Art" exhibit catalog. This work is illustrated on page 12, and the catalog entry appears on page 51. [3] Prior to its donation, this work was on loan to the Museum since December 1954.

Updated and under review by CGK.

creator.birth_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
